channel.title: Damn Small Linux on Made By Nathan
channel.description: Recent content in Damn Small Linux on Made By Nathan

item.title: Compaq Evo T20 projects
item.description: Compaq Evo T20s are fun. I have a few that I’m using for various projects. I plan to set one up as a RFID controlled alarm/door lock system. Its running Damn Small Linux using ruby, rubygems and sinatra packages that I compiled myself. Karl Mowatt-Wilson’s tutorials have been a huge help with flashing the T20s with linux images, as well as the open-evot20 site. I wrote a K8055 USB Ruby C wrapper for the K8055 USB interface experiment board (bought from here).
